summary:
Jaap Koot is a medical doctor specialised in public health and health management with a postgraduate degree in International Health and Tropical Medicine (KNMG) and Master in Business Administration. He works in education and research in the university and in international health and development.  He has experience in the Netherlands, in Central and Eastern Europe and in middle- and low-income countries all over the world. 
His research concentrates on policy development to reduce inequities in health, for example in community health for prevention of non-communicable diseases. In education he focuses on global health care management and health promotion. He supports public health institutes in low-income countries in strengthening research for evidence-based policy making.

Specialties: medical doctor, public health, health promotion, management, quality assurance, health literacy, monitoring and evaluation

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
Royal Tropical Institute, Amsterdam, the Netherlands

education.degree_name: Diploma Tropical Medicine and International Health
education.grade: Medical Doctor with Profile International Health and Tropical Medicine (AIGT)

organizations.name: NVAG Nederlandse Vereniging voor Artsen in Beleid Management en Onderzoek van de Gezondheidszorg

projects.title: Member of College of Capacity Coordinators UMCG
projects.description: Advisor to Learning Communities in the G2020 curriculum of the Faculty of Medicine in the University of Groningen in the area of development of competencies of medical students. Focus on development of the CanMEDS competencies of organising and advocacy.

projects.title: Scoping potential activities in health in Zimbabwe for Swiss Development and Cooperation
projects.description: Analysis of health sector support needs in Zimbabwe against priorities of Swiss Development and Cooperation. Advising on potential projects which contribute to better health of vulnerable groups in Zimbabwe, especially adolescent girls.

projects.title: IROHLA
projects.description:
IROHLA stands for intervention research on health literacy among the ageing population in Europe. It aims to make an inventory, quality assessment and selection of the most effective interventions to improve health literacy among the older people and to improve health care communication with the people. The final product will be a policy advice for European stakeholders in health care and a manual with 20 of the most feasible interventions in the area of health literacy.
The results of IROHLA will be presented during the IROHLA end-conference on 17 November, which is part of the 3rd European Health Literacy Conference. See www.healthliteracyconference.eu. On this date the website www.healthliteracycentre.eu will be launched.

projects.title: EU-FP7-IROHLA project
projects.description: Het ontwikkelen van twee brochures om beleidsmakers in overheden en zorginstellingen te informeren over Health LIteracy (gezondheidsvaardigheden) in het kader van het EU IROHLA project. De afkorting IROHLA staat voor Intervention Research On Health Literacy among Ageing population

contributors.headline: Content Creator bij Careflex Zorg Groep
Chief Executive Officer at DVK Media Group

projects.title: Business Plan CCBRT Organisation
projects.description: Technical support for production of a Business Plan for the whole CCBRT organisation, the biggest Maternity Hospital, Disability Hospital and Community Based Rehabilitation Centre in Tanzania. The Business Plan will comprise of formulation of core-business, business models, organisational structure, market analysis, marketing plan and sustainable financing strategy.

projects.title: Formulation of the fourth Health Sector Strategic Plan in Tanzania (HSSP IV)
projects.description:
Team Leader of team working with the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare and other stakeholders on formulation of a strategic plan for the period 2015 - 2020. This plan will include the health-related key results areas of the National Big Results Now programme, priority topics of achieving the universal coverage of quality health care in Tanzania.
The process is formulation includes all interested parties through the Technical Working Groups, Through an extensive process of costing activities and estimating the resource envelope a prioritised cost-effective plan will be formulated, which is realistic in the Tanzanian context.

projects.title: Reproductive Maternal and Neonatal Health
projects.description: Formulation of Reproductive Maternal and Neonatal Health Programme for pastoralist communities in Ethiopia for the Consortium of the international NGO Cordaid and the local NGOs APDA, OWDA and EPARDA. Reaching women and girls in most remote areas for better health.

projects.title: Mid Term Review Malawi Health Sector Strategic Plan
projects.description: Mid Term Review of Malawi Health Sector Strategic Plan 2012-2016, assessing progress of implementation, identifying success factor and critical issues for improvement, and formulating recommendations for further action to improve quality of healthcare in Malawi.

projects.title: Evaluatie transitie jeugdzorg in de William Schrikker Groep
projects.description: Externe evaluatie van voorbereiding en uitvoering van transitie jeugdzorg in de William Schrikker Groep, landelijke organisatie voor jeugdbescherming, jeugdreclassering en pleegzorg. Advisering met betrekking tot activiteiten binnen de organisatie om beter voorbereid te zijn op de nieuwe Jeugdwet 2015

projects.title: External verification and evaluation of Performance Based Financing in the Health Sector In Sierra Leone
projects.description: External verification of the achievements of performance based financing (PBF) in 1250 primary health units in Sierra Leone, and two national hospitals. Assessment of the quality of data collection and utilisation of  funds received through PBF. Formulation of recommendations for strengthening the PBF system and increasing effectiveness. Recommendations for strengthening health management information system.

projects.title: Strategic Planning CCBRT Maternity Hospital Dar es Salaam
projects.description:
Assistance to the management of the CCBRT organisation in Dar es Salaam, which has entered into a public-private partnership with the Government of Tanzania establishing a new 190 bed maternity hospital in Dar es Salaam. The hospital will serve as super-specialist hospital to care for complicated deliveries and referrals for the 4 million people living in the city. 
Development of a strategic plan for the service package, the organisation of the hospital, human resources, and improved collaboration with the maternal healthcare providers in the city.

projects.title: Evaluation of Performance-Based Financing in Uruzgan, Afghanistan
projects.description:
Evaluation of performance-based financing programme for delivery of health services in Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Assessment of the increase in quality, efficiency and effectiveness of innovative financing mechanisms of health services. Is results-based financing possible in a conflict area? Does it add value for the population?
Recommendations to improve the effectiveness of PBF by redesigning the approach, especially the transparency of procedures of management of health facilities, of verification and of reporting.

projects.title: Innovatie zorgberoepen en opleidingen
projects.description: Focusgroep discussies met beroepsgroepen, opleidingsinstituten, zorgverleners en andere belanghebbenden over een toekomstvisie op de gezondheidszorg en op de daarbij passende beroepsopleidingen. Project onder verantwoording van het Verweij-Jonkers Instituut. Onderdeel van een groter project onder verantwoording van CVZ.

projects.title: Mid Term Review Tanzania Health Sector Strategic Plan
projects.description:
Between May 2013 and October 2013 Jaap Koot was team leader of the review of the implementation of the Health Sector Strategic Plan 2009 - 2015. The team assessed whether Tanzania is on track in achieving the Millennium Development Goals and achieving other targets formulated.
The review produced recommendations for action to enhance quality and efficiency of health care, especially for maternal, neonational and child health.

contributors.headline: Health financing, systems and policy specialist

projects.title: Mid Term Evaluation Ifakara Health Institute, Tanzania
projects.description: Mid Term Evaluation of the NICHE project in Ifakara Health Institute, which aims at strengthening the the capacities of the institute in research and in training. Formulation of priorities for the period 2013-2015 ensuring research quality at international standards.

projects.title: Mid Term Review Results Based Financing project in Zimbabwe
projects.description: Results Based Financing (RBF) is an innovative way for financing decentralized health services on the basis of outputs rather than inputs. In Zimbabwe the World Bank applies this method of financing to increase and to improve maternal and child health services in 18 districts in the country. The Mid Term Review concluded that this approach is successful. The health facility staff at grass root level is very committed, as is the health facility committee (consisting of community representatives). Giving decision power and financial means to the grass root level organizations is an effective way to enhance provision of quality health services.

projects.title: Planning of health care services in Afghanistan
projects.description: Jaap Koot has been providing technical support to healthcare services in Afghanistan since 2006. This support consisted of capacity building in planning and monitoring of health services. Based on epidemiological analysis and medical priorities he assisted from January 2013 - March 2013 in developing new healthcare plans for two provinces in Afghanistan as well as for a provincial hospital. The emphasis is on improving health care for pregnant women and children and on improving access to healthcare for the most vulnerable population in these provinces.  Cordaid and partners will continue implementing primary health care in Uruzgan and Zabul provinces until 2018.

contributors.headline: Coordinator of the Technical Secretariat of the National Food Security and Nutrition  Agenda
Toezichthouder, auditor, publicist in zorg en welzijn

publications.name: Kwaliteit van zorg in maatschappelijk perspectief

authors.headline: Program Manager Quality in Practice and Senior advisor Prevention at NHG (Dutch College of General Practitioners); Public Health Advisor at BOJAN Advies

publications.name: Insecticide treated bed nets in Tanzania: challenges in reaching the most vulnerable groups

profile_positions.description: Research into screening for cervical cancer in Europe, Asia and Africa, using home-based self test for HPV and artificial intelligence for vaginal inspection with acetic acid (VIA). This approach with increase efficiency and effectiveness of cervical cancer screening in resource constrained environments. It will contribute to earlier detection and treatment of cervical cancer and on the longer term the eradication of cervical cancer.
profile_positions.title: Research Coordinator PRESCRIP-TEC

profile_positions.description: Working in team to improve competency-focused education in Bachelor Phase of Medical Study Programme in UMCG. Develop new modules for learning communities in the Bachelor Phase.
profile_positions.title: Advisor development of competency-focused medical education

profile_positions.description: Mentor for medical students in UMCG who follow two-months' internship abroad, mostly in low- or middle-income countries.
profile_positions.title: Student Mentor Internships Social Medicine

profile_positions.description: Coordinator of Research Project Scaling Up NCD Interventions in South East Asia (SUNI-SEA), financed by the European Union. The research takes place in Indonesia, Myanmar and Vietnam, and concentrates on diabetes and hypertension prevention and control in communities and primary healthcare facilities. The action research looks the synergies between (self-managed) community interventions and NCD control programmes in peripheral clinics. The aim is to formulate recommendations for cost-effective interventions in low- and middle-income countries. The research is for 4 years, from January 2019  until December 2022.
profile_positions.title: Research Coordinator SUNI-SEA

profile_positions.description: Team leader of education programme aiming at building competencies of international medical Bachelor students at the University Medical Center Groningen. The education programme covers the CanMEDS competencies, focusing on Global Health. International health and social determinants of health provide the students' learning context. By broadening the view of medical students on their future profession, they will able to function in an global and multi-cultural environment.
profile_positions.title: Dean Learning Community Global Health

profile_positions.description:
Scientific Coordination of international research project into health literacy of the ageing population in Europe, with as objectives to improve health literacy policies in European member states through introduction of evidence based interventions for empowerment of ageing people and for improved communication in the health sector. See for more information http://www.irohla.eu.
Member of the European Innovation Partnership on Active and Healthy Ageing, action group adherence.
Chair of the 3rd European Health Literacy Conference on 17 - 19 November 2015 in Brussels. (See www.healthliteracyconference.eu)
profile_positions.title: Scientific Coordinator IROHLA project: healthy ageing and health literacy

profile_positions.description:
Koot Public Health Consultants (KOOTPHC) is the company of Jaap Koot (MD-IHTM MBA), specialised in international public health and health care management. Jaap Koot is experienced in developing, managing and evaluating programmes in healthcare and public health in the Netherlands, in Europe and in low- and middle-income countries. He has long-term experience in policy advice to Ministries of Health and International Health Organisations.
He is now focusing mainly on strengthening research in health institutions in low-income countries to improve policies and practices in health care.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: The EU financed Support to Public Health Institutes Programme strengthens health organisations (institutes, universities, national laboratories) in developing relevant research for evidence-based policy making in health in low-income countries. The Monitoring Facility offers technical support to the programme, and facilitates mutual learning of the projects within the programme, with the aim to develop a sustainable methodology for strengthening health research for policy. The Monitoring Facility contributes to improved internal an external monitoring for drawing lessons learned from projects.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Support to Public Health Institutes  Programme - Monitoring Facility

company.name: Training Institute for Physicians in International Health and Tropical Medicine

profile_positions.company: Training Institute for Physicians in International Health and Tropical Medicine
profile_positions.description: The training in International Health and Tropical Medicine is a training registered by the Dutch Royal Society of Physicians, under auspices of the Netherlands Society for International Health and Tropical Medicine. Jaap Koot works part time in the training institute with as focus quality assurances of teaching courses in international health.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director

profile_positions.description:
The Netherlands Institute for Health Promotion supports professionals in public health and in education, as well as groups in the community to improve health of the population. The institute concentrates on health of youth, vulnerable groups and the ageing population.
The institute works for example for schools, companies and municipal health services to improve health promotion services. Health literacy is one of the areas of expertise of the institute. Per August 2012 NIGZ has been incorporated in CBO (a TNO company).
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: Coordinator of consultancy firm in international health care management and capacity building in public health. Manager of many international health care projects in Europe (the Netherlands, Croatia, Slovakia, Bulgaria, Poland) and in developing countries (Tanzania, Zambia, Afghanistan). Special interest in building quality systems in health care (planning, monitoring and evaluation) and in strengthening public health  services for vulnerable groups (health literacy).
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: In charge of Dutch funded primary health care programme in Western Province in Zambia, piloting elements of health sector reforms. Introducing local community empowerment, and decentralized management of health services, with local budgets and local planning, monitoring and evaluation systems.
profile_positions.title: Primary Health Care project advisor

volunteer_experiences.description: Het Kwaliteitsbureau Sociale Geneeskunde is verantwoordelijk voor het onderwijs aan artsen in het domein sociale geneeskunde om hun individueel functioneren te verbeteren, zoals wettelijk vereist door de Nederlandse overheid.

Chairman of the Supervisory Board.

MCNV’s strategic goals are based on the three principles of action by the WHO Commission on Social Determinants of Health:
- Improve the conditions of daily life – the circumstances in which people are born, grow, live, work, and age.
- Tackle the inequitable distribution of power, money, and resources – the structural drivers of those conditions of daily life   – globally, nationally, and locally.
- Measure the problem, evaluate action, expand the knowledge base, develop a workforce that is trained in the social determinants of health, and raise public awareness about the social determinants of health.
MCNV’s policies and programmes aim to influence the social determinants of health for its target groups among the disadvantaged and to contribute to improving health equity. MCNV pays special attention to reducing marginalisation in its partner countries and to documenting and sharing the approaches and results of successful interventions.
See www.mcnv.org

company.name: NVAG (Netherlands Association for Health Policy, Research and Management)

volunteer_experiences.description:
NVAG is the Dutch professional association for medical doctors in policy, research and management, and has the mission to strengthen the link between medical scientific knowledge and policy development. It offers professionals the opportunity to exchange experiences and develop their capacities of developing evidence-based health policies. NVAG is part of the umbrella organisation for public health practitioners (KAMG). He represents the NVAG in the Governing Board of the KAMG.
See www.nvag.nl and www.kamg.nl
